effect: When you play this card, immediately Plow 1 field.
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive 1 additional Food. From Round 8, you receive 2 additional Food.
Whenever you add a room to your Wooden hut, you only pay 2 Wood and 2 Reed.
Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Baker's Oven to convert up to 2 Grain into 5 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" Action.
Clay Ovens and Stone Ovens are Minor Improvements for you. Clay, Stone and Wood-fired Ovens cost you 1 building resource (of your choice) less.
You receive either 1 Wood or 1 Clay when you play this card.
At any time, you can convert Grain to 2 Food (without having to Bake bread.)
When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables on this card as though it were a field. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)
Whenever you convert any 2 goods to Food at one time using a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth or Cooking Corner, you receive 1 additional Food.
At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 2 Food Sheep: 1 Food Wild Boar: 2 Food Cattle: 3 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 2 Food.

At the end of the game you receive 1 Bonus point for each room in your Stone house. (In total, you receive 3 points instead of 2 per room.)(If you have played the Mansion, you do not score extra points for having the Half-timbered House.)
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food or 1 Reed.
At the end of the game, if your pastures occupy 6/7/8/9+ farmyard spaces, you receive 1/2/3/4 Bonus points.
Place 2 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of each round, you receive the Food.
Whenever you convert Vegetables to Food using a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth or Cooking Corner, you receive 1 additional Food.
Whenever you turn 1 Wood into Food using the Joinery, Sawmill or Cabinetmaker, you receive 1 additional Food. You can choose instead to turn a second Wood into exactly 2 Food.
Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Wood-fired Oven to turn any number of Grain into 3 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.
At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for a Clay hut or 2 Bonus points for a Stone house.
You can hold up to 2 additional Sheep in each of the pastures where you keep Sheep. You can keep up to 2 Sheep in each unfenced stable.
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food and 1 Reed.
Place 1 Food on each remaining odd-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
Whenever you Sow fields with Vegetables, place 1 additional Vegetable on each field that you Sow.
When you play this card, you receive 2 Food. From now, the Pottery is a Minor Improvement for you and costs you nothing.
Whenever you use a person's action to take Wood from an Action space, you can leave 2 of the Wood on the Action space and receive 3 Food in exchange.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action, you receive 1 additional Grain.
You can replace 1 or 2 Reed with the same amount of Clay whenever you extend or renovate your home.
Whenever you add a room to your Clay hut, you can pay 2 Clay, 1 Wood and 1 Reed instead of 5 Clay and 2 Reed.

The Madonna Statue has no effect. (You must remove Improvements that are on the table in front of you. You may not discard cards from your hand. It is irrelevant whether you remove Major or Minor Improvements.)
When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable.
When you play this card, immediately Fence one space in your farmyard. (You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.)
Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you receive 2 additional Food.
When you play this card, you receive either 1 Stone or 1 Reed.
Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space for rounds 8 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
The Outhouse has no effect. You can only build it if at least one other player has fewer than 2 Occupations. (It is irrelevant how many Occupations you have played.)
Place 1 Wood on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Wood.
Place 1 Grain each on the spaces for rounds 5,8,11 and 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain.
On this card, you can plant Vegetables as you would on a field. Vegetables on this field can be converted to 4 Food when harvested. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)
Place 1 Reed each on the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of each round, you receive the Reed.
Whenever you use an "Occupation" Action, you may play 2 Occupations one after another. The second Occupation costs you 2 Food.
You can Renovate your Wooden hut to a Clay hut at any time without using the "Renovate" action. (You must still pay for the Renovation.)
Whenever you have 3/5 Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1/2 additional Food.
When you play this card, immediately build 1 stable. (The stable does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown to play this card.)
Whenever you have Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1 Food for each third Sheep. Whenever you have Cattle during the Field phase, you receive 1 Food for each second Cattle.
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action, you receive an additional 3 Stone.
When you play this card, immediately extend your Stone house by 1 room. (The room does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown to play this card.)
Whenever you use one of the "Stone" Action spaces that become available in Stage 2 and Stage 4, you receive 1 additional Stone.
Place 1 Food each on the spaces for rounds 10 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
On this card you can hold up to 2 animals of you choice. They need not be the same type of animal. (This card does not count as a pasture for scoring.)(This card does not give you animals.)
Each pasture (with or without a stable) can hold up to 2 more animals.
When you play this card, return 1 Sheep to the supply and take 1 Cattle.
Twice during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1.
Once during the game, when you use either "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Vegetable" Action space, you also receive 1 Grain. When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable from the supply.
This card counts as 2 Occupations for Minor Improvements and when scoring the "Reeve" Occupation card.

Whenever another player Bakes bread, you can Bake bread if you have a Baking Improvement with the bread symbol. If you take a Bake action yourself (not using this card), you receive 1 additional Food.
During each Harvest, you may Bake bread at the start of the Feeding phase if you have an Improvement with the bread symbol. When you play this card, you may Bake bread as an additional action.
Once during the game, at any time after your home reaches at least 5 rooms, you may extend it by 1 room at no cost.
Whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood, you receive an additional 1 Food.
At the end of the game, you can discard up to 2 Begging card without losing points for them.
In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, the Master Brewer can convert up to 1 Grain to 3 Food.
You receive 1 Food for the supply for each Grain that is baked whenever any player (including you) Bakes bread. (To Bake, you need a Baking Improvement with the bread symbol.)
Whenever you convert Wild boar to Food, you can choose to place the boar on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/3/4 slaughtered Wild boar.
Pay 1 Reed less to Build each room, for each Renovation, and for each of the Water Mill, Half-timbered House, Chicken Coop, Holiday Home, Mansion and Corn Storehouse.
At any time, you can use the Turner to convert any number of Wood to 1 Food each.
You can use any Build room(s) or Family growth Action space, even if another player has already placed a person on it.
The next time you build fences, take 1 Wild boar. Each time you build at least 1 fence after that, take 1 Cattle.

Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you can choose to take twice as much Food as is on the space. If you do this, you must give 1 Food each to the Fishing Rod, Raft, Canoe, Fish Trap and Landing Net.
If you have an Oven, you can change your animals into Food an any time. Take 2 Food for each Sheep, 3 for each Wild boar and 4 for each Cattle.
You can use the "Take 1 Vegetable", "Plow 1 field" and "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action even if another player has placed a person on the space.
Include the "2 Wood" Action card from the 3-player game as an additional forest. At the start of each round, place 2 Wood on the card. Any player who uses this action must pay you 2 Food.
At the end of the game, you only lose points for Unused spaces and Begging cards.
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you also receive 1 Vegetable.
Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you receive 1 Grain in addition to the Food.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you also receive 1 Vegetable.
Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you can leave 1 Food on the space and take 1 Vegetable instead.
At the end of a 3/4/5 player game, if no player has more animals of any type than you, you receive 2/3/4 Bonus points.
At any time, you can use the Dock Worker to convert 3 Wood to either 1 Clay, 1 Reed or 1 Stone, or to convert 2 Clay, 2 Reed or 2 Stone to 1 other building resource.
At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each room in your Stone house. (In total, you receive 3 points per room instead of 2.) Playing this card costs an additional 2 Food.

If another player plays the "Chief" card, you can play this card immediately at no cost. (You can also play it using an Action space in the usual way.) At the end of the game, you receive 3 Bonus points if you have a Stone house, 1 if you have a Clay hut.
At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Occupation that you play after this one.
Whenever you build at least 1 fence, you can build 3 additional fences without paying any additional Wood. (You can only place fences if they enclose a complete pasture.)
You receive 1 additional Wood whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood.
At the end of the game, you receive 1 bonus point for each room in your Wooden hut.
Play this card during Stage 1. At the start of Round 11, you can extend you hut by 1 room at no cost, as long as you have not yet renovated to a Stone house.
Whenever you use the "Minor Improvement" or "Minor or Major Improvement" action, you can pay 1 Food to use the action a second time.
When you play this card, take 1 Vegetable that you may Sow immediately if you have an empty plowed field. (You can Sow just this one Vegetable with this extra action.)
In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, only 2 of your people eat 2 Food each; all others are satisfied with only 1 Food.
You receive 1 Food and 1 Wood whenever any player (including you) builds a Baking Improvement with a bread symbol.
In each Harvest, the Basketmaker can convert up to 1 Reed to 3 Food.
Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Vegetable, Reed, Clay, Wood, Vegetable, Stone, Grain, Reed on this card. At any time, you may buy the top item for 1 Food.
You can use the Clay Firer at any time to convert 2/3 Clay to 1/2 Stone.
You can use the Clay Seller an any time to convert: 2 Clay to 1 Sheep or 1 Reed, 3 Clay to 1 Wild boar or 1 Stone, and/or 4 Clay to 1 Cattle.
Place 1 Clay on each of the spaces for rounds 6 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Clay.
Whenever one of your people's actions gives you only Clay, you receive 2 additional Clay.
At the end of the game, you receive 1 bonus point for each scoring category where you have scored the maximum 4 points. (The bonus point is also awarded for 4 fenced stables.)

Once you have built a Clay hut, place 1 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (If you already have a Clay hut or a Stone house when you play this card, place the Food immediately)
Once during the game, at any time after your Stone house reaches at least 4 rooms, you may extend it by 1 room at no cost.
In the future, whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 2 Food before you pay the costs of the Occupation.
If, when you play this card or later in the game, you are the last player to have only 2 rooms in your home, you receive 3 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Stone.
Once you have a Stone house, you can pay 1 Food at the start of each round to Plow (at most) 1 field.
Whenever you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action spaces, you can pay 1 Food to Plow 1 additional field.
Whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood from an Action space, you can leave 1 of the Wood on the space and take 2 Food in exchange.
At the end of the game, you receive 1/3/5/7/9 Bonus points for having 5/6/7/8/9+ Improvements in front of you.

In rounds 10 and 12, all other players may not place 1 of their family's Offspring* (if they have any).(You yourself may place all your Family members.)This card may only be played until the end of Round 9. (*) Offspring are a player's 3rd, 4th, and 5th Family members.
Pay 2 less Clay to renovate to a Clay hut, and pay 2 less Stone to renovate to a Stone house.
You can renovate your Wooden hut to a Stone house without first needing to renovate it to a Clay hut.
Add 5 and 9 to the current round. Place 1 Cattle on the corresponding Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Cattle.
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 1 additional Grain. From Round 6, you can choose to receive 1 Vegetable instead.
During each Harvest, if you have at least 4 Sheep during the Breeding phase, you receive 2 lambs instead of 1 as long as you have room for them.
Place 1 Sheep on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Sheep.
Place 1 Reed on each of the next 4 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Reed.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space, you receive 1 additional Wild Boar from the supply. (The "Take 1 Wild Boar" Action is added in Stage 3.)

Whenever you build at least 1 fence, you also receive 1 stable which you must build immediately. (This may be built inside or outside the fenced area.)(You do not need to pay any Wood for the stable.)
One (and only one) of your unfenced stables may hold up to 3 animals of the same type.
You can use the Quarryman at any time to convert Stone to Food. For each Stone you convert, take 2 Food.
Whenever you take Stone with an action, you can also take 1 additional Stone. If you also receive other building resources, this costs you 1 Food.
All Improvements, Rooms and Renovations cost 1 Stone less.
Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you receive at least 4 Food. (If there are 1 to 3 Food are on the space, take Food from the general supply until you total 4 Food.)

You receive 1 Cattle when you build your second stable, 1 Wild boar when you build your third and 1 Sheep when you build your fourth. (If you build several stables at once, you may be entitled to take several animals as well.)
In each Harvest, the Potter can convert up to 1 Clay to 2 Food.
You immediately receive a loan of one of each type of animal. Before scoring, return the 3 animals. For each animal that you cannot or do not want to return, you lose 1 point.
You can keep Sheep, Wild boar, and Cattle in the same pasture. This applies to all your pastures (except the Forest Pasture).
Take 1/2/3/4 Wood if there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play. At the end of the game, all players with the most played Occupation cards receive 3 Bonus points each.
To extend your home, you need only 3 of the appropriate building resource and 2 Reed for each new room. (For example, if you live in a Wooden hut, you need 3 Wood and 2 Reed.)
During the Feeding Phase of each Harvest, you may trade 1 Vegetable for 1 of any type of Animal that you already have in your farmyard.

You receive 4 Wood when you acquire the Joinery or play the Cabinetmaker. When you acquire the Pottery or play the Potter, you receive 4 Clay. When you acquire the Basketmaker's Workshop or play the Basketmaker, you receive 3 Reed. If you have already played any of these cards when you play the Guildmaster, you receive 2 building resources of the appropriate type for each existing card.
Once the total printed building cost of all the major improvements you have is at least 9 building resources, this card provides room for 1 person for the rest of the game.
You can build fences at any time without placing a person. (This is not considered a "Build Fences" action.)
Immediately after each time you place a person on an action space card, you can pay 1 food to place another person on the card immediately left to it (and so on).
At the end of each work phase, if both the "Fishing" and "Traveling Players" accumulation spaces are occupied, you get your choice of 1 grain or 2 food.
Once this game, at the start of a work phase of your choice, you can turn this card face down to get all of the clay on the "Hollow" action space.
Immediately before each time you place a person on an action space with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension, you can buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.
Each time you take at least 3 clay from the "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain. If you take at least 6 clay from it, you also get 1 vegetable (instead of grain).
When you play this card, if you have another occupation in play and more wood than all other players combined, you immediately get wood from the general supply until you have 15 wood.
Place 1 stone and 1 food on all action spaces with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension. Next time you place a person on them, you get the goods.
Each time another player builds a room, you immediately get 1 wood.
Each time you use either "Quarry" accumulation space, you immediately get an additional 1 sheep from the general supply.
Each time you use the "Animal Market" action space, you can pay 1 food to use the same option twice (instead of once).
For each major improvement built by the other players, you can keep 1 animal on this card (max. 8). You can keep different types here.
When the "Pig Market" and "Cattle Market" action space cards are each revealed (and placed on the round space), you can immediately fence exactly 1 farmyard space without playing wood.
This is an action space for you only. It provides a choice of "Fencing", "House Redevelopment", or "Vegetable Seeds" if the corresponding action space is already in play.
At the start of each round, if 3/4/5+ players each have at least 1 cattle, you get 1/2/3 food.
Each time you use an action space with the (meeple) symbol, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.
Each time you use the "Riverbank Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 vegetable.
Each time the other players harvest grain from at least 3/4/6 fields combined, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.
The Village Idiot is your lone occupation. Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, you get 1 wood and 1 food.
Each time you plow at least 1 field, you also get 1 stone.
Immediately after each time another player uses the "Resource Market" action space, you can also place a person there to take the action as well.
In the returning home phase of each round, if at least 3 wood accumulation spaces are occupied, you can pay 1 wood to get 1 wild boar.
Each time you take 1/2/3 food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 cattle/wild boar/sheep.
Immediately after each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can renovate your house to clay/stone without paying reed.
When you play this card, if you have no pastures yet, you can immediately fence exactly 1 space in your farmyard without paying wood for the fences.
In the returning home phase of each round, you can pay 1 food to either take a "Minor Improvement" action or to draw 2 new minor improvements.
Each time another player plows a field, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.
Each time the "House Building" action space on the game board extension is used, you get all of the food from the "Traveling Players" accumulation space.
At the end of each work phase, if 1 stone accumulation space has stone left, you get 1 grain If 2 stone accumulation spaces have stone left, you get 1 vegetable instead.
Immediately after each time you use a "Lessons" action space, if this is the 1st/2nd/3rd occupied Lessons action space that round, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.
Each time you use the "Farmland", "Cultivation", or "Farming Supplies" action (the latter only being available with 6 players), you also get 2 clay.
Immediately after each time you use an accumulation space on the game board extension, you can buy 1 stone for 1 food.
At the start of each harvest, you get 1 building resource of your choice.
Each time you create at least one new pasture from unfenced farmyard spaces you get 1 cattle.
Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, if this is the 2nd/3rd/4th occupied wood accumulation space that round, you can buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 1 food.
Each time another player takes at least 4 wood from an accumulation space, you can immediately pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
This card is an action space for all. It provides a "Build Fences" action and then 1 sheep. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.
Each time another player pays food on a "Lessons" action space, you get exactly 1 of that food.
At any time, you can exchange 1 reed for 2 food.
Each time a major improvement is built, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.
Each time you use the "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can also buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.
Each time any player (including you) takes a "Renovation" action on an action space, you can sow crops in exactly 1 field.
In the work phase of each round, the first and the second time you use a wood accumulation space, you also get 1 and 2 clay respectively.
When you play this card you immediately pay 1 food. If you do, you get 2 stone and 2 reed.
Each time all three "Lessons" action spaces are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get your choice of 1 building resource or 1 crop of each type.
When both action spaces on round spaces 3 and 6 are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get 1 cattle and 2 food.
Each time you use an accumulation space with exactly 2/4/6 goods on it, you can leave 1/2/3 goods on the space. If you do, you get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.
You can immediately build a stable at no cost, but only if you place it in a pasture covering exactly 1 farmyard space.
Select 3 occupations in your hand. Select one of them randomly, which you can play immediately without paying an occupation cost.
You immediately get 1 wood for each room you have. If you have more rooms than people, you get 1 additional wood.
If you have the Well, Joinery, Pottery, and/or Basketmaker's Workshop, you immediately get 1 stone, 1 wood, 1 clay, and/or 1 reed, respectively.
You immediately get 1 food for each grain field you have and 1 grain for each vegetable field you have.
You immediately get 1 grain and 1 vegetable.
This card can only be played via a "Major Improvement" action. It provides room for one person. You may no longer renovate.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wild boar. You can hold 1 wild boar on each of your unplanted field tiles.
When you play this card, you immediately get 3 clay. Immediately after, you can renovate without paying any building resources.
Each time you build at least 2 wood/clay/stone rooms at once, you get a total discount of 2 reed as well as 2 wood/3 clay/4 stone.
Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, if you then have at least 7 wood in your supply, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood.
After the next time you take animals from an accumulation space and accommodate all of them on your farm, you can plow 1 field.
Once this game, when you use the "Farmland" or Cultivation" action space with the first person you place in a round, you can plow 2 additional fields.
When you play this card, you can immediately plow up to 2 fields.
Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action while having more rooms than people already, you also get a "Family Growth" action and 1 food.
Add 1 to the current round for each fence in your supply and mark the corresponding round space. In that round only, you can place a person from your supply.
Immediately after each time you use a "Quarry" accumulation space, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action during which you must spend at least 1 stone.
Each work phase, you can place a(nother) person on the first non-accumulating action space used by any player (including you), as long as there is only 1 person on that space.
When you play this card, you get 2 wood and you can immediately build the "Clay Oven" or "Stone Oven" major improvement. Either way, it only costs you 1 clay and 1 stone.
You can consider the "Lessons" action spaces not occupied. You can replace each food that an occupation costs with wood.
In the returning home phase of each round, you can pay exactly 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point. If you do, each other player gets 1 food.
Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 food and 1 bonus point.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each major improvement you have, up to the number of your unused farmyard spaces.
Each time you build 1 or more fences, you can also use this card to exchange 1 wood and 1 fence in your supply for 2 food and 1 bonus point.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you return a person from the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 2 bonus points for each newborn that you return home.
When you play this card, you can exchange any number of food for 1 bonus point each, up to the number of completed harvests.
Each time you renovate, you can also pay 1 wood to get 1 bonus point and 1 grain.
This is an action space for all. A player who uses it gets 3 bonus points. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 grain.
Immediately place 1 clay on each unused space in your farmyard. Each time you turn a space into a used space, you get the clay and you can immediately exchange it for 2 food.
Each time you upgrade a Fireplace to a Cooking Hearth, you immediately get 2 wood and 1 vegetable (not retroactively).
Each time you use the "Fishing"/"Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 wood/food.
Each time you build 1 or more stables in one turn, you place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Once you no longer live in a wooden house, place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you use the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Immediately place 1 food on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you have built. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time after you obtain at least 1 wood, if you then have 5 or more wood in your supply, you can exchange 1 wood for 3 food. With 7 or more wood, you must do so.
Each time 1 reed is placed on a non-empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space during the preparation phase, you get 1 food.
Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food.
Each time you use a wood accumulation space while there is at least 1 wild boar on the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you also get 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you must pay 1 food, or else take a begging marker.
When you play this card, if you have at least 1/3/4 sheep, you immediately get 2/3/4 food. The same applies if you have at least 1/2/3 cattle.
In the returning home phase of rounds 8, 10, and 12, you can take 1 vegetable from exactly 1 vegetable field. You can immediately exchange it for 3 food and 1 bonus point.
Each time after you harvest 1+ vegetables, if you then have 3+ vegetables in your supply, you can turn exactly 1 vegetable into 6 food. With 4+ vegetables, you must do so.
At any time: Vegetable → 4 Food; Sheep → 3 Food; Cattle → 5 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
After the field phase of each harvest, you can use a baking improvement but only to turn exactly 1 grain into food. (This is not considered a "Bake Bread" action.)
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1/2/3 grain for 0/1/2 bonus points and exactly 3 food.
In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each grain field that you harvest.
Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space while already having an animal of that type, you get 1 grain.
Each time you build a number of fences equal to or greater than the current round, you immediately get 1 vegetable.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can move 1 vegetable from one of your fields to your supply. (This is not considered a field phase.)
Each time you use a "Quarry" accumulation space, add 1 additional good of the respective type to each of your planted fields growing a single type of crop.
Each time after you turn at least 2 unused spaces into used spaces in one action, you get an additional "Sow" action.
Each time you build 1 or more stables on your turn, place 1 wood on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.
At the start of each work phase, if you have at least 1 clay in your supply, you can exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 clay and 1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 clay. Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you immediately get 2 clay.
Each time you take an unconditional "Sow" action planting vegetables in at least 1 field, you get 1 clay and 1 stone.
Each time you use a clay/reed/stone accumulation space, place 1 wood/clay/reed on this card. At the start of rounds 7, 11, and 14, move all the goods on this card to your supply.
Each time after you use an action space, you can take 1 building resource from a building resource accumulation space with at least 4 building resources on it.
In each returning home phase after which there is no harvest, you can pay exactly 1 grain—even from a field-to breed exactly one type of animal.
Exactly one clay or stone room in your house can hold an additional person if the room is adjacent to both a field and a pasture.
Add 3, 6, and 9 to the current round. You can place 1 stable on each corresponding round space. A the start of these rounds (not earlier), you can build the stable at no cost.
Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can also play 3 food to plow 1 field.
Each time you add rooms to your house, you can also pay 1 wood and 1 grain to immediately get a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.
Each time you decline an unconditional "Sow" action on your turn, you can immediately place another person on an action space of your choice (even if it is occupied).

Immediately add 1 cattle from the general supply to the "Cattle Market" accumulation space. Afterward, you get 1 grain plus 1 food for each cattle on "Cattle Market".
Before the start of each round, if you have more building resources than all other players of at least two types, you get 1 food.
Each time before you place a person, if there are at least 8 wood total on accumulation spaces, you get 1 food.
At the start of each round, if there is more food on the "Traveling Players" than on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get the difference from the general supply.
Each time before you use the action space on the most recently revealed action space card (after it has been placed on the round space), you get 1 grain.
When you play this card, if you have at least 2/4/5 unplanted field tiles, you immediately get 1/2/3 vegetables.
This card is an action space for all. If another player uses it, they get 3 wood and must give you 1 wood from the general supply. If you use it, you get 4 wood.
Each time any player (including you) takes 5/6/7/8+ goods from an accumulation space, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone from the general supply.
Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you get 1 sheep from the general supply.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, instead of 2 food, you can get 3 different animals from the general supply. If you do, you must pay 1 food each harvest left to play.
You can immediately plow 1 field such that it completes a "zigzag" pattern.
You can immediately take a "Renovation" action.
You can immediately sow in exactly 1 field.
You immediately get 1 clay for each planted field you have.
Immediately exchange up to 3 wood for 1 stone each.
You get 2 food and 1 grain, which you must sow immediately.
Your pastures of size 1 can hold up to 3 animals of the same type. (With a stable, they can hold up to 6 animals of the same type.)
At any time, you can renovate your house to stone. From a wooden house, this costs 1 stone, 1 reed, and 1 food per room. From a clay house, this costs 1 stone per room.
Immediately before you renovate to stone, you get 2 clay and 1 reed and you can take a "Build Rooms" action.
Each time before you use the "Sheep Market"/"Cattle Market" accumulation space, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood/at no cost.
Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you can pay 3 food to plow 1 field.
Immediately after each returning home phase, you can pay 2 wood and 1 food to use the "Farmland" action space without placing a person.
Immediately after each time you use a clay accumulation space, you can pay 1 clay to plow 1 field. If you do, place that 1 clay on the accumulation space.
Provided you have room in your house, each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Family Growth" action instead.
Add 1 to the current round for each building resource you have and place 1 person from your supply on the corresponding round space. In that round, you can use the person.
This card is an action space for you only. In rounds 3-5, it provides a "renovation" action. In rounds 6-8, it provides your choice of 1 vegetable, wild boar, or cattle.
As long as you have exactly 4 people, in the work phase of each round, you can place your third and fourth person immediately after one another, even on the same action space.
This card is a field that you can sow in, an occupation, and the "Fireplace" major improvement with all of its effects. You can play it only via a "Minor Improvement" action.
You can build the "Joinery" and "Well" major improvement even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action, or you can build both with a single "Major Improvement" action.
At the end of each turn in which you renovate, you can exchange your Joinery for the Pottery or your Pottery for the Basketmaker's Workshop.
During scoring, you get 2/5/8 bonus points for having 3/4/5 major improvements from the bottom row of the supply board.
During scoring, you get 1/2 bonus point for each pair of grain plus vegetable you have (considering all crops in your supply and fields), rounded up.
During scoring, if you had at least 7 goods in your fields before the final harvest, you get 2 bonus points.
During scoring, if you live in a stone house, you get 2 bonus points for each unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your house. (You still lose the points for these unused spaces.)
During scoring, if you then have more stone rooms than people, you get 4 bonus points. You can only use one card to get bonus points for your stone house.
During scoring in a game with 1/2/3/4+ players, you get 1 bonus point for every 7th/5th/4th/3rd animal on your farm.
During scoring, if you gained at most 2 sheep from sources other than breeding during the game and have not turned any sheep into food, you get 3 bonus points.
Alternate placing 1 clay and 1 wild boar on each remaining round space, starting with clay. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the amount of wood in your supply. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Once per round, you can pay 1 reed. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 2 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food. (*Occupations and Improvements)
Before the start of each round, if you have more occupations than improvements in your hand, you get 1 food.

This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it immediately gets 1 food. Immediately before the returning home phase, they can use an unoccupied action space with the person from this card.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you have more clay than wood in your supply, you get 1 food.
Once per round, you can skip placing your second person and get 1 food instead. (You can place the person later that round.)
At the start of each work phase, if there are at least 3 food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 food from the general supply.
Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get 1 additional food.
Each time you turn a sheep or wild boar into food using a cooking improvement, you get 1 additional food.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
At the end of each action in which you sow vegetables in a field, you get 1 food for each vegetable field you have (including the new ones).
At any time: Vegetable → 3 Food; Sheep → 2 Food; Wild boar → 3 Food; Cattle → 3 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
At any time: Clay → 2 Food Scoring: 3/5/6/7 Clay → 1/2/3/4 bonus points
At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 3 grain fields (including field cards with planted grain), you get 2 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can turn 2/3/4 grain into 3/6/9 food.
In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each harvested field tile that is orthogonally adjacent to your house.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can take a "Bake Bread" action. "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
In the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 2 grain, you get 1 additional grain from the general supply.
Place 1 grain on each of the next 3 of the round spaces 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.
Each time you use the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can pay 1 reed to get 1 vegetable. If you do in a game with 4+ players, place that 1 reed on the accumulation space.
Before the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to add 1 vegetable to each of up to 2 vegetable fields.
At any time, if a field contains exactly 1 good as a result of a harvest, you can discard that good and immediately take a "Sow" action limited to that field.
In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional good from a number of fields equal to the number of unfenced stables you have.
At the end of each turn in which you use the "Farm Expansion" action space or build an improvement, you get 1 wood back for every 2 wood paid during those actions (rounded down).
Immediately after the feeding phase of each harvest, if you have no food left, you get 1 wood and 1 clay.
Each time after you build an improvement costing at least 2 clay, you get 1 stone.
Each time you renovate, you pay 1 fewer reed and, at the end of the action, you get 1 stone.
Each time you use the "Fencing" action space, you also get 1 wild boar.
As soon as you have 6 occupations in front of you (including this one), this cards provides room for one person. In the draft variant, you need 7 occupations to play this.
You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation card in front of you (including this one), unless it is already able to hold animals.
From round 5 on, if you have room in your house, at the end of each person action, you can take a "Family Growth" action with that person. If you do, you get 2 negative points.
Once per work phase, after you complete a person action, you can pay 1 sheep and 2 food to return another person you placed home.
Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action with the second person you place, return the first person you placed home, unless it is on the "Meeting Place" action space.
When you play this card, immediately build a major improvement. When paying its cost, you can replace up to 1 building resource of each type with 1 food each.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, after the final harvest, you get 1 bonus point for each person for which you then pay 1 clay.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each scoring category in which you score the maximum 4 points. (The bonus point is also awarded for 4 fenced stables.)
At the start of each returning home phase, you can return a built stable to your supply to get 1 wood, 1 grain, 1 food, and a "Minor Improvement" action.
Each time you use "Fishing" or "Reed Bank", you can pay 1 food to immediately place another person on this card. If you do, you get your choice of 3 stone or 1 grain plus 1 vegetable.
Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get 1 food. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, you also get 1 grain.
At any time, you can pay 1 grain. If you do, add 2 to the current round and place 4 food on the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you get the food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time after you use an action space with the "Sow" action, you get 2 food.

Each time you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you also get 1 grain and, afterward, you can take a "Sow" action.
For each grain you harvest from a field, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3 food. If you harvest the last grain from a field, the vegetable costs you only 2 food.
This card is a "1 Wood" accumulation space for you only. Each time the newly revealed action space card is a "Quarry" accumulation space, you must discard all wood from this card.
For each new wood/clay room you build, you get 2 clay/2 stone.
At any time, you can place a good from your supply on this card to get 1 stone. You must place different goods on this card. (Food is also considered a good.)
Each time you use a wood or clay accumulation space, you can also buy exactly 1 building resource. Wood, clay, and reed cost 1 food each; stone costs 2 food.
Pile 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 reed, 1 clay, and 1 wood on this card. Each time you harvest a field tile, you can also take the top good from the pile.
This card is an action space for you only. If each other player has more rooms than you, it provides the "Day Laborer", "Building Rooms", and "Major Improvement" actions (all three).
Each harvest in which you have at least 5 wood in your supply, you can discard down to 5 wood to take a "Build Stables" or "Build Wood Rooms" action by paying the usual costs.
At the end of each work phase in which you did not use the "Meeting Place" action space, you can take a "Build Rooms" action without placing a person.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 stone. You can build any of the major improvements in the bottom row of the supply board even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action.

Each time the "Fishing" accumulation space is used, you get 1 bonus point and must skip placing your next person that round. (You can place the person on a later turn.)
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most vegetables in their fields gets 2 bonus points.
If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most fenced stables gets 2 bonus points.
Each time after you use a "Lesson" action space, you can buy up to 2 different goods: grain, stone, sheep, and wild boar for 1 food each; cattle and vegetable for 2 food each.
Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, both they and you get 1 food (before taking the actions). If you use it, you get 1 food.
Each time you take at least 4 building resources or 4 animals from an accumulation space, you also get 1 food.

Each time you use an accumulation space providing at least 3 goods of the same type except wood, you get an additional 1 wood. (Food is also considered a good.)
When you play this card, if you have 1/2/3/4 major improvements, you immediately get 2/3/4/5 reed.
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, place 1 food, 1 food, and 1 wild boar on the next 3 round spaces, respectively. At the start of these rounds, you get the good.
Each time another player uses a "Quarry" accumulation space, you can choose to get 1 food or build a stable without paying wood.
Each time you take a "Family Growth" action with the second person you place in a round, return the first person you placed home.
Immediately after each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can place another person on an action space of your choice, regardless whether or not the action space is occupied.
At the start of each of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, if you have at least 1/2/3/4/5/6 grain fields, you get 1 bonus point.
Each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood into 1 food and 1 grain.
Place 3 grain and 3 food on this card. Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space, you also get 1 grain and 1 food from this card.
As soon as the next player but you gains their 5th person, you immediately get 8 food (not retroactively). During scoring, if only you have 5 people, you get 3 bonus points.

Each time another player uses the first person they place in a round to take a "Family Growth" action, you get 1 grain from the general supply.
Each time any player (including you) renovates and the builds no/ 1 minor/ 1 major improvement, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3/2/1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 stone. Each time another player renovates to stone or builds a stone room, you get 1 stone.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if afterward you have no animal in your house, you also get 1 sheep.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if you occupy either the action space immediately above or below that accumulation space, you also get 1 wild boar.
Each time you build at least 2 stables on the same turn, you also get 1 cattle.
You immediately get 1 wood. After each round that does not end with a harvest, you can breed exactly one type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)
You can immediately build up to 3 stables at no cost.
Immediately renovate to clay at no cost. (You must pay the cost of this card though.)
Immediately return your person on the "Grain Utilization" action space home; you can place it again later this round.
Immediately remove all grain from one of your fields to the general supply. Gain 2 wood for each grain you just removed.
Immediately remove exactly 2 different building resources from accumulation spaces and place them in your supply.
You immediately get 1 building resource of each type of which you have 4 or more resources in your supply already.
You immediately get 4 food. (Effectively, you are turning 1 grain into 4 food.)
You immediately get 1 vegetable. (Effectively, you are buying 1 vegetable for 2 food.)
Up to two times: Immediately spend any 2/3/4 building resources for 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from the general supply.
At the end of the work phases of rounds 3 and 6, you can move your person from the "Farmland" action space to an unoccupied action space and take that action, or get 1 food.
"Bake Bread" action: At most 1 time Grain → 6 Food When you play this card, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.
"Bake Bread" action: At most 1 time Grain → 3 Food When you play this card, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain for every 2 completed rounds.
Each time another player (or, in a solo game, you) uses the "Forest" accumulation space, you get 1 grain.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you get 1 additional grain for each baking improvement you have.
This card is a field on which you can only sow and harvest wood as you would grain. Each time you harvest the last wood from this card, you also get 1 vegetable.
This card is a field that can only grow vegetables. Each time you harvest the last vegetable from this card, you can plow 1 field.
This card is a field. Each time you remove the last grain or vegetable from this card, you can immediately sow vegetable or grain on this card, respectively.
Each time you sow in a field that is orthogonally adjacent to a pasture, you can place 1 additional good of the planted type in it.
This card is a field. During the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 1 good from this card, you also get 1 food.
During the field phase of each harvest, you can select exactly one of your fields and harvest all the crops planted in it.
When you play this card, immediately place (up to) 5 fences from your supply on it. When you build fences, fences taken from this card cost you nothing.
Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can return 1 stone to the general supply to get an additional 3 wood.
When you play this card, you can immediately return up to 3 stables from your farmyard board to your supply and get 3 wood for each.
Each time you get reed and/or stone from an action space, you get 1 additional clay.
When you play this card, you can immediately exchange up to 4 building resources for an equal number of other building resources.
Each time after you sow in at least 1 field, you get 1 stone.
You can only plant stone on this card. Plant as though it were 3 fields, but it is considered 1 field. Sow and harvest stone on this card as you would vegetables.
This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it gets 1 building resource of each type they already have. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can exchange 1 building resource for another building resource.
At the start of the breeding phase of each harvest, if you have at least 1 unfenced stable without an animal, you get 1 sheep.
You only require 1 sheep to breed sheep during the breeding phase of a harvest. This card can hold 1 sheep.
For each wild boar or cattle that you turn into food, you can place 1 of that food on this card. While its food equals your number of rooms, this card provides room for 1 person.
At any time, you can place wood from your supply on this card, irretrievably. You can keep twice as many animals of any type on this card as there is wood on it.
At the end of the work phases of rounds 7 and 9, you can take a "Renovation" action without placing a person and pay 1 building resource of your choice less.
Once you live in a stone house, at the start of each round, you can pay 2 or 3 wood to build up to 3 or 4 fences, respectively.
After you play your 2nd, 3rd, 5th, and 7th occupation (including this one), you can build 1 stable at no cost.
Each time you get 2 or more newborn animals, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
You can build the Joinery when taking a "Minor Improvement" action. If you use the Joinery (or an upgrade thereof) during the harvest, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
Once this game, if you live in a house with exactly 2 rooms surrounded by 4 field tiles, you can use any "Family Growth" action space even without room.
On your first turn each round, if you have no unused farmyard spaces, you can place a person from your supply.
When you play this card, immediately take a "Renovation" action. Afterward, you can take a "Build Fences" action. (Both actions require their usual cost.)
You can immediately build a baking improvement by paying its cost. Each time another player uses the "Grain Seeds" action space, you can take a “Bake Bread” action.
You can play this card at the start of the work phase of round 1 without placing a person. (This card has no effect other than counting as a played occupation.)
If this is your 3rd occupation, you can immediately play another occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food and/or play 1 minor improvement by paying its cost.
If this is your 1st occupation, you immediately get 1 bonus point for each improvement you have. (This will not apply to improvements played after this card.)
At the end of each harvest, if you live in a stone house, you get 1 bonus point.
At the start of each work phase, if you have at least 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable in your supply, you get 1 bonus point.
When you play this card, you get 1 bonus point for each complete stage left to play. You may not play any more occupations.
At the start of each round, you may pay food equal to the number of people you have to buy 1 good of your choice from the general supply.
Pile (from bottom to top) 1 clay, 1 wood, and 1 grain on this card. Each time you get a good matching the top item, you can move that item to your supply and get 1 wild boar.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, place 3 vegetables on the space for round 11. At the start of that round, you get the vegetables.
When you play this card and each time before you use the most recent action space card, you get 1 building resource of your choice and 1 food.

In the field phase of each harvest, if you have at least 2/4/6/7 fields, you get 1/2/3/4 food.
Each time you build fences, place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the number of fences just built. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1 reed for 2 food. You can build the Basketmaker's Workshop for 1 reed and 1 stone even when taking a "Minor Impr." action.
At the start of each harvest, you can place 1 wood from your supply on this card, irretrievably. In each feeding phase, you get 1 food for each wood on this card.
As long as you have no minor improvements in front of you, you get 1 food at the start of each round and 1 wood at the start of each harvest.
Each time you would harvest a grain field, you can leave the grain on the field and take 1 grain from the general supply instead.
Each time you take a "Family Growth" action, you also get 1 vegetable.
When you build your 1st and 2nd stable, you get 1 grain. When you build your 3rd and 4th stable, you get 1 vegetable. (This does not apply to stables you have already built.)
Each time after you use the "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you can take a "Bake bread" or "Sow" action, respectively.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. Each time after you use an animal accumulation space with your 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th person, you get 1/1/2/2/3 wood.
At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 1 grain field, you get 2 wood.
Each time you get food from an action space, you get 1 additional wood.
If you play this card in round 4 or before, place 4 wood and 4 clay on the space for round 9. At the start of this round, you get the resources.
Alternate placing 1 wood and 1 clay on each of the next 6 round spaces, starting with wood. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective resource.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you also get 2 or 3 clay, respectively.
Each time you play or build an improvement, you get your choice of 1 wood or 1 clay immediately after paying its cost.
Pile resources as depicted on this card. (stone, clay, stone, reed, wood, clay) You can use the top item(s) when building a room, playing/building an improvement, or renovating.
You immediately get 2 wood and 2 stone. During scoring, you get 1 negative point for each wood and each stone in your supply. You can no longer discard wood or stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 building resource of your choice and, once all people have been placed this round, you can place a person from your supply.
Once you live in a stone house, at the start of each round, you get your choice of 2 wood, 2 clay, 1 reed, or 1 stone.
When you play this card, if you would score the maximum 4 points in 3 scoring categories (including fenced stables), you can extend your house by 1 room at no cost.
Each time after you build a major improvement, you can pay 1 food to plow 1 field.
If you have a person on the "Day Laborer" action space, you can use non-accumulating round 1-9 action spaces even if they are occupied.
Each time you use a "Wish for Children" action space, you can play 1 additional improvement by paying its cost less 1 resource of your choice.
Immediately after each time you place your last person in a round on the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can play 1 occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.

Each time you place 2 or 3+ newborn animals on your farm during the breeding phase of the harvest, you get 1 or 2 bonus points, respectively.
Each harvest, you can place 1 harvested crop or 1 newborn animal on this card, irretrievably. Once this game, exchange 2/3/4/5 different goods on this for 3/5/7/9 bonus points.
If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most total vegetables gets 3 bonus points.
